Review_title: A Premium Ultrabook with not so Premium Price.
Review_body: I did quite an extensive study before purchasing this laptop. Why? Because I do not replace my laptop every year or so, I am not that Ritchie Rich type. My last laptop Lenovo Z50-70 was purchased 5 years ago, and it is still rocking as per current standards although I did swap out the HDD with an SSD for performance boost and battery backup is around 2.5 – 3 hrs which is surprisingly decent as per today’s standard.My point being I already  trust Lenovo brand with longevity and after sales support, but I wanted to try other brands just for a change. Apple was out of the scene since I wanted 15.6-inch screen and a Windows OS. So, I looked for other players like Dell, HP, Asus and Acer. Asus and Acer have quite an extensive line-up but from April – June 2020, most of them are on 8th gen processors. Plus, I have my doubts regarding its after sales support because they outsource it to private vendors instead of in-home service center.Coming to Dell, I am shocked to see that people end up paying the ‘Dell tax’. What does it mean? Well a 65K Dell Inspiron has a all plastic body, two decades old TN display, terrible battery life and users complaining about constant heating issues. HP has a similar story with partial plastic body and a TN display hiding under their marketing term as ‘SVA’ display.Leaving me no choice I looked at Lenovo and I immediately liked S340 and S540 (the model I am reviewing). S340 was 5-7k less expensive but lacked fingerprint sensor and has only partial metal body. I wanted full premium experience under 65K, so I opted for the more expensive S540.All right, enough chit chatting. Now couple of pointers, you all are already bored with specs sheet, so I’m gonna spare you with that. Instead I’m gonna focus on the core user experience.Display: A display is the most important component of a laptop because you will be looking at it all the time. And it is expected to be at least good if not the best. Sadly, this is the least thought component in the segment.An FHD IPS Anti-glare display was best I was getting in this range and only Lenovo offered me from the top 3 brands. 250nits brightness is sufficient for day to day task and may feel short under direct sunlight although matte coating helps a lot in dispersing the indoor and outdoor light.I personally feel that color gamut should have been 72% NTSC or the 99%sRGB and not 45% NTSC which is the case here but then again, no other brand is offering the 72% in this price range. Not at all happy about this.Overall, if u don’t need an accurate color reproduction for professional photo editing, the display has best viewing angles, sufficient brightness and contrast for the binge watching or while working on that colorful assignment of yours.Keyboard and Touchpad: Lenovo is known for their keyboard and the one present on this device has good amount of travel, satisfying clickety clackety sound and enough spacing between the keys along with a premium glass frosted touchpad with windows precision gesture support. The inclusion of Numpad is the best decision which for some reason companies have started skimping on it and the two levels of brightness just for the backlight of the keyboard is icing on the cake.Battery Life: This model claims of up to 12 hours battery life which is a very bold claim for the given specs. I am happy to report that Lenovo lives up to their marketing term because I managed to squeeze out around 10+ hrs of battery from 100% to 35% on moderate use and I believe that it would have gone beyond 11+ hrs till it dropped dead to zero. I have also seen newer ultrabooks in the market barely touching a 5hr mark, so all in all this device has a terrific battery life without any doubts.Design: That exquisite full metal thin and angular body with diamond cut edges along with professional looking choice of color is a premium to look at and hold. The plastic body found in other brands is just no match in terms of looks and feels. Easy win for Lenovo.Processor, RAM, Graphic Card and Storage: Comet Lake Core i5 processor along with a 2gb Nvidia MX250 graphic card and 8gb of ram expandable up to 12gb with 256gb of SSD (best in this segment) and 1 TB HDD (a high quality). A good balance of storage and speed.Gamers stay away as this is meant for professionals and students and in no way can do serious gaming. This laptop tends to stay cool but running a GTA V with normal graphics and 1366 X 768p resolution heated the CPU to 65-70-degree Celsius range. And that amount of heat can affect the battery health and the laptop components with regular use.Nifty Features: Fast and Accurate Fingerprint sensor, the manual camera shutter for the privacy, the included MS Office 2019 home version along with 1 year of Lenovo Premium Warranty and Accidental Damage Protection, the Always On USB port for charging your other devices without waking up the laptop and inclusion of proper led indicators and ports (ultrabooks usually skimp out on HDMI and USB A port) overall makes this laptop the ‘Perfect’ ultrabook.But wait, there is nothing as Perfect in this world. And so far, it has been a love fest. So, bear with me for few more minutes while I cover the cons of this device.Fan Placement: I don’t like the fact that the placement of fan is at the bottom of the device. Because of its thin angular body, there was no space for a side vent thus pushing it to the bottom. At high loads, it might cause distress while using on a lap and may add to more thermal gains. Sadly, it is the case with every ultrabook out there so nothing much can be done.Speakers: Claiming to be Dolby Audio and placed at bottom of the device, these are just barely loud to cover your needs. In a quiet room they’re adequate for binge watching although it lacks the bass. I would suggest investing in good headphones or external speakers if you consume media a lot.Processor: This comes with Intel’s Comet Lake 10th Gen processor but it should have been an Ice Lake variant since it is fabricated on 10nm as opposed to 14nm and it is 2020. I guess that better display than other brands, Lenovo included was a trade-off keep the price lower and, in my opinion, a smart move. Those who are not aware, there is not much difference in terms of speed and processing it is just that Ice Lake is couple of months newer than Comet Lake.Camera: It's 2020 and Lenovo is still using a 720p HD 1MP webcam which is honestly way too bad. It's even bad for video calls. Luckily for me, I am not much into that. But if you are one of those rare breeds who rely on their laptop webcam, you have been warned.You made it to this far in the review, then I can be assured of that I started making sense all along which kept you such long and I personally thank you for sticking until now.My final thoughts to conclude the review. After a long detailed study on displays, processors and other components I came to a conclusion that Lenovo Ideapad S540 (Model: 81NG002BIN) with the thin full metal body having good display and sensible specifications along with Lenovo’s premium support for 1 year is the best bang for the buck you can get in the sub 65K market. Sure, it has some quirks but those can be simply ignored considering the overall package it fits into. I am confident that this device would be an ideal companion for College Students and Professionals likewise.

I was looking for a laptop with the following features:1) Thin & Light Design2) 15.6 inch screen with very thin bezel3) FHD display of 1920x10804) Expandable RAM with minimum of 8GB memory5) Hybrid Storage [SSD (For fast booting)+HDD (For critical data storage)]6) Dedicated Nvidia Graphics with atleast 2GB Memory7) Core i5 10th Gen processorTo my surprise this was the only laptop on Amazon to fulfill all my requirements.I was a bit skeptical to buy this looking at the mixed reactions from people. However, I will say this is a must buy product for people having requirements inline with mine.Thermal performance was initially an issue as the laptop was heating up in a short duration but with a quick update of Lenovo Vantage app which helped in enabling the "Intelligent Cooling" mode from the app which fixed the issue.Battery backup is amazing as well with a wonderful display quality. I received close to 10 hours of battery backup which was mind blowing.Looks is also stunning with metallic housing and sleek design.

Bought is for my partner and it's one of the best devices used in all these years. If I could change one thing then it would be its weight as I use hp laptop however its value for money and is fully loaded.

Review_title: Hate you Amazon but love you Lenovo
Review_body: After a lots of study I found that this laptop is one of the best looking and featured laptop present in market in the price range between 60 to 70 K. Lenovo is a pure Chinese brand and I had bad experience in past. But the new Lenovo changed a lot. Coming back to some customers review, they reported of having received defective product and less days warrenty. Ok let me clear you all, this laptop costs arround 63 K and due to covid amazon increased the price and also I got this laptop after 15 days due to random unavailability. My 1st order got cancelled after 15 days cause they told me the order was archived (my guess due to out of stock, and for the same reason some of you got defective product) and in case of warrenty, you can update the purchase date from Lenovo's site by providing amazon's bill.Talking about laptop:Pros: Superior build quality and the unibody aluminium chessy give the laptop a premium looks, I guess this is one of the best looking laptop in the market right now. Students to business professionals, developer to casual use suits for every person. Latest Intel 10th Gen processor and Nvidia MX250 good for photo and video editing, light gaming and codding. SSD is superb, as per technical specification this is the fastest SSD installed in any device in this price range. Its a 2280 4 channel Hynix SSD and capable of 32 GBPS where rest are 2280 2 channels 16 GBPS. 2x2 intel non vpro wifi is great. Display coud be 300 nits and 72% color gamut, but its not, still manageable, though a different model of S540 have this feature but didn't find the model in amazon or local market. Extra 1 tb ssd, free windows, office 2019 and McAfee 1 year total security are extra bonus. Finger print works perfectly, keyboard backlit is ok, privacy webcam sutter is a very good features, speaker downfiring but still good. Glass touchpad just awesome. Some easter eggs like always on usb port, Charging level indicator during laptop off, lenovo vantage driver update, fast charging on-off, on laptop in ac mode without using battery, os backup and reset dedicated key and offline backup, different charging light blinking indicator, performance mode selector, different usefull function keys just extra add onsCons: RAM could be 2666Mhz, but its 2400. Bluetooth 4.2, not 5. Weight is 1.8 kg but still felt heavy. Battery very poor, max backup 4-5 hours in medium usage. Overhitting during gaming. 1 usb type c which doesn't support power delivery. Those who have screen flickering issue, please dont panic. Update bios and nvidia driver in safe mode or contact your local expart or lenovo techincl expart face to face. And yes keyboard, if you are not a lenovo user it will take time to habituate, keyboard could be better. And please provide one bag or sleeve in online purchase.Those who are interested to increase the warranty, please perches 1699 rs tps tech warrenty along with this, cause its not a cheap laptop at all.
Bad Speaker and online streaming issue (Video and voice mismatch), otherwise good laptop
Defective laptop. Amazon must ensure avoid this type if inconvenience to its die hard customer.

Bought this laptop from a local store today for 2k off the price quoted on Amazon, this laptop is worth the money.Boot up time is under 7 secs, color of the laptop is mineral gray, pretty nice compared to other colors. At store, I had played video/audio on several other laptops of same configuration - thanks to the amazing IPS Full HD display, it rocked on video display compared to other laptops. Could have been better if the 8Gb RAM could be from a single slot, its currently a 4G+4G occupying 2 slots. The bezel display is another charmer, very thin, easy to carry, laptop battery gave me 7 hours on full charge. The built-in camera has two modes, to close the shutter when not in use, fingerprint sensor for secure login. Laptop came with licensed copy of Windows 10 and office, both 64-bit edition. This laptop is definitely worth the money.

Review_title: My Worst Nightmare. Terrible Support from Lenovo.
Review_body: Note: I did not buy this on Amazon. I bought this frome the Lenovo website.Right when the lockdown struck us in early 2020, I decided to buy this laptop to prepare for my career progress plan.On paper this was the best config I could get under 70K (it was being sold at around 67K on Amazon then)The laptop arrived and within a couple of weeks I found out the audio was abysmal. I tried atleast 3 different earphones/headphones to make sure the problem was not with my earphones. After that contacting Lenovo was almost impossible as their lines would always be busy (limited staff the message said)And when I finally made contact, after making me update the drivers, reinstalling my OS, they shoved a 7 day (DOA - dead on arrival) policy in my face saying that since I had not reported it within 7 days I would not be offered a replacement. The best they said was they could get someone to repair/replace the motherboard.I put my foot down and so did they. The consumer forum was no big help either. So now I am stuck with a 60K+ laptop with a crackling audio which means my learning plans get crippled and I am left with a glorified browser.btw the laptop speakers are useless. At full volume you will get some decent sound.Moral: In the first seven days, test out all you can, and if you find one thing out of line, do not hang up till they connect (This comes with a one year support warranty)The next machine I buy will definitely not be a Lenovo.

It's been a month struggling with support people and still they didn't fix my freeze issue and it had gotten worse.  Service engineer guy tried to fix it and made it even worse,  now the track pad is also not working.
Must buy this is ows products for a college student

Review_title: Sleek yet Heavy, Powerful yet weak !
Review_body: The laptop is a beast when it comes to performance and ease of use. The design is very sleek. From afar, it just looks like a sheet of steel when closed. However, its not very light as it looks to be. I expected it to be much lighter and was disappointed with its weight.The battery performance is decent. I am getting around 5-6 hours of battery. I only browse, watch tutorial videos and code (heavily).The most disappointing feature of this device is its sound. The quality of the speakers is just pre-historic. Very feeble in sound. I have to connect to a earphone each time I have to listen to a video.The display quality is excellent. Lenovo has done a great job with this laptop in the display aspect.The laptop is best if you are a working professional or a coder. But if you want to game, create content, and for any general entertainment purposes, I don't recommend it.

I am writing this review after 2 weeks of usage. Actually my daughter is using this laptop for studying purpose.First of all, I would like to thank Amazon for delivering the laptop in good condition and in on time. Thank you so much. Since my daughter is using I asked her many times, how the laptop is working and she said it's quite wonderful.  I am happy that she doesn't complain anything about the laptop so far.  Few points I would like to high light  over here1. The laptop is very handy and light weight.2.  Boots up and shut down is so fast.. amazing.3. 256 GB ssd adding great value to the speed4. Display is amazing.5. Finger print , keyboard backlit ,  webcam shutter is a very good featuresIf you have double minded to buy this laptop, don't think about it, Please go ahead. Nice laptop.
Overall the laptop is quite good, but the battery backup is not up to the marks, and the fast charge is also not effective. Display quality is good, camera and privacy options are also good.

13/11/2020:The screen flickering issue is still an issue when the laptop is not placed on a stable ground, like if you hold the laptop in your hand in air the screen tends to flicker, I guess its some kind of loose connection or something. But nothing is wrong when it is placed on a laptop and screen is at any angle.This issue was solved when I updated windows but I guess it was a mere coincidence that it got solved right at that time.One thing I didn't like is that the USB and power port at both really tight, maybe due to the slim design. It's hard to plug in and plug out through the ports. You feel like it's gonna break.9/11/2020:There was a screen flickering issue, which was solved when the nvidia and bios was updated. Warrenty issue was fixed by mailing the amazon invoice to pop@lenovo.comSo you don't have to worry about these two issues.I saw a few reviews where the hinge was broken, luckily I didn't have this problem until now and don't know if it will fall apart after daily usage. For the camera part some reviews have shown it is the wost camera in a laptop. I feel these people haven't used a webcam before and was expecting high selfie qualities in a laptop. The camera is pretty decent, I must say. I thought it will be really bad after reading reviews, but I'm really happy about it. The bootup speed is 7-8 seconds and finger print unlock works in just a second. And for the weight, its pretty heavy and not a lightweight laptop. It weights around 1.8kg to 1.9kg but the build quality except the hinge is really good. With the lenovo vantage app the updates and customisation of different modes is really easy.Display and sound quality is good. I will update this review after heavy and long usage.
The product is osm with good features well and good for daily usage

Review_title: Display started behaving abnormally after 1 year of use
Review_body: This laptop is a great package you might get in this range. But after 1 year of use, my laptop screen suddenly developed pink patches all over the screen. And unfortunately my warranty was over so the Lenovo chat/email service didn't address my issue and I had to get it repaired from the service centre. Although the same problem might not happen with you because I used my laptop extensively (about 12 hours a day), and developing a issue after such a heavy use is normal. But if you are considering buying this laptop I will highly recommend extending your warranty from 1 year to about 3 years by paying some extra charges on pcsupport.lenovo.com

Review_title: Pathetic build quality, heating issue, horrible customer service, and just another average laptop.
Review_body: Bought this laptop in August looking at the decent specifications, didn't know that the disappointment will start in September. The bezel of the laptop came out in less than a month and since then to date, I am following up with the customer relationship team of Lenovo to resolve this but absolutely no response. The build quality of the laptop and the body of laptop is, simply put, horrible. The battery life is decent however it faces a heating issue. The good thing is the privacy shutter can hide the pathetic camera of the laptop. So not go by the fancy specifications of the laptop, trust me this comes from personal experience, it's not worth it. I have now understood why people keep recommending HP & DELL only over Lenovo. I am writing this so that no one has to learn this the hard way like I did. Do not buy this laptop. Lenovo is one of those companies which has zero after sale interest. Neither will Amazon help you.
Best laptop in this price range .I got it for 69000 has extra features like - finger print  and backlight keyboard.Best laptop in my life.I loved it . Go for it
I purchased it after a good research. Now I am very happy with it. I am using it 10hrs in a day and wonderful experience in every minute

The product arrived in good condition. As the warranty is from manufacturing date, I have 11 month warranty remaining. Not a big deal for me, as I fix my own laptop.With a weeks testing, the laptop is good for decent workloads. People who face issue (crashes etc.) watching YouTube videos, make sure to make nvidia your default graphics card for your browsers and other applications. The default is intel’s integrated graphics card. Sadly you have to set this for each program individually. This also frees up CPU resources. 8gb ram is okay (no lag found yet) for normal workloads. Will upgrade the ram to 12/16gb as need arise. Battery life is okayish with battery lasting for 5-6 hrs with moderate use. This could have been better.

Finally, a different delivery person came I showed him where the serial number is and he took.Beware there is no real communication link between the amazon business team, leadership(because my case was escalated to leadership team), and the local person handling pickup, they have no control on them.I will strongly advise to buy costly gadgets from your local dealers. If you are stuck with a faulty gadget with even minor issue , amazon business team will not be able to resolve it for you.

Review_title: A very good configuration at a reasonable price
Review_body: I spend almost 8hrs a day on my Laptop. This laptop seems to be a little pricy, but at this price, the configuration is a good combination. The laptop looks sleek and compact. The screen resolution is high and the text is pretty crisp.After almost 7 days, the laptop doesn't heat up, the performance seems to be on the peak with the 10th generation processor. Corei5 has many plus points than the corei3, however, the difference is not that much noticeable between i5 and i7.Overall this laptop is faster, lightweight and doesn't heat up on your lap.The downside is that the ethernet port is missing.The USB 3.2 is a plus point, but I really can't use USB 3.2 for my old storage disks.Overall the laptop is great for all-day work with loads of graphics processing.

Product is good. I purchased this laptop since Lenovo gave BackToSchool offer .But its 100% fake; they have impossible hidden rules to avail this offer. They will move your order ticket to On-Hold easily.Rule No 1: In my case, I purchased Laptop to deliver at my work location. But your Government ID should have the same delivery address in Permanent Address Field. I cleared in call & they asked to send alternative documents; But Lenovo support team has the habit to move to On-Hold. SO its waste of time to clear your side words.Rule No2:They need the Dealer Seal Attestation in Bill. But you wont get Seal Attestation in online order Bill. So they moved my ticket to On-Hold to upload bill with Dealer seal. So you cant avail this offer if you purchase the laptop online.In their mail, you can see customer care number and email; but you ll get respond with automated mail and voices  only.  So please avoid Lenovo if you want to purchase with their 'Back2School' offerSo pl

Review_title: This laptop will put a smile on ur face (if you are not expecting a good camera). Go for it "Laptop"
Review_body: Got this product delivered in a day. The packing is not that great, as they wrapped a carton box which is about slightly bigger than the actual laptop box. But that's okay, as it is Amazon delivered.While checking the laptop found that the camera is not working (i.e. it was showing an orange circle even with the manual shutter open). I was about to raise a return request. But on having a closer look, I realized that there was a sticker over the camera lens mentioning about the camera manual shutter position. Once I pealed it off, I was happy to see camera is working... Oh thank God..!!!!First look review:* Laptop looks sleek but feel bit heavy while lifting. That heaviness will make you understand the build quality.* Full metal finish body.* Nice IPS display.* With Cortana enabled, Windows setup was very easy.* Excel can be seamlessly activated following the steps mentioned in YouTube video.* Wow.. It has caps lock and Num lock "ON" indicator light over the keys. Also a watermark displayed on screen while toggling them. (not some thing new, but feeling good as my earlier laptop didn't have this).* Nice back-lit keyboard. Initially I felt there is no much difference between two brightness levels in normal light. But on low light I could see significant difference in brightness levels.* The keyboard tray is sturdy.* Eye catching chrome boarders for Power button, Track pad and Finger Print scanner.* While registering finger print, it seems slow. So I doubted will it be the same while logging in. But it is not. Finger print login works nice and fast.* Boots up and Shut down in 3-5 sec max.* You will get 1 year free subscription for McAfee LiveSafe. Good...!!* Nice quality speakers with sharp sound and pleasing chillness.* Track pad has integrated button for right and left mouse keys, which was new to me. And I was struggling to find the location of the keys. After using it for some time, I felt some what comfortable. But still being conscious while using right mouse click.* Media keys (Play, Pause, Stop, Prev and Next) placements over Num-pad is a very comfortable position to use them.* While typing this review I could feel the advantage of having "U" shape in key bottoms. It really makes you to enjoy typing. And the key travel is very less.* Not sure why, I was hitting Num-Lock key instead of back-space when I started typing. I have to check the usual full sized keyboard layout. After using for some time, I could able to hit backspace properly.* Till now I felt laptop runs very silent. But could hear a fan spinning more for some 15-20 sec while updates was going on.* I could not see a 3D hologram sticker for Intel processor. The sticker for 10th generation processor looks very simple reflective sticker.* Finally there is a web camera just to show it is there. Because the resolution is very low.That's it.. Will update review after using it for a month.
The product is good but I am upset as the costly laptop doesn't come with a carry case.
if you purchase from Lenevo official website, get a more discount compare to Amazon with cash back offer. Over all good product but not so light. Battery backup not satisfactory.

This is something i would want Amazon to clarify why it is so.3) The Keyboard is of the chiclet form and honestly if you are a person who is using the laptop for a lot of typing work then i would recommend that you would reconsider. The keyboard is not bad but its definitely not good for its price.4) It comes with FREE OFFICE HOME AND STUDENT 2019 for the full time and not just a trial. It also comes with a 1 year MCAFEE anti virus protection plan for free.5) I was little skeptical after reading all the screen flickering issues faced by some of the people who bought the laptop, i also faced screen flickering issue but if u update your BIOS and other things, it ceases to flicker.Overall I would say this is a must buy laptop, if your price range is between 50k-75k. Review_title: A Premium Ultrabook with not so Premium Price.
Review_body: I did quite an extensive study before purchasing this laptop. Why? Because I do not replace my laptop every year or so, I am not that Ritchie Rich type. My last laptop Lenovo Z50-70 was purchased 5 years ago, and it is still rocking as per current standards although I did swap out the HDD with an SSD for performance boost and battery backup is around 2.5 – 3 hrs which is surprisingly decent as per today’s standard.My point being I already  trust Lenovo brand with longevity and after sales support, but I wanted to try other brands just for a change. Apple was out of the scene since I wanted 15.6-inch screen and a Windows OS. So, I looked for other players like Dell, HP, Asus and Acer. Asus and Acer have quite an extensive line-up but from April – June 2020, most of them are on 8th gen processors. Plus, I have my doubts regarding its after sales support because they outsource it to private vendors instead of in-home service center.Coming to Dell, I am shocked to see that people end up paying the ‘Dell tax’. What does it mean? Well a 65K Dell Inspiron has a all plastic body, two decades old TN display, terrible battery life and users complaining about constant heating issues. HP has a similar story with partial plastic body and a TN display hiding under their marketing term as ‘SVA’ display.Leaving me no choice I looked at Lenovo and I immediately liked S340 and S540 (the model I am reviewing). S340 was 5-7k less expensive but lacked fingerprint sensor and has only partial metal body. I wanted full premium experience under 65K, so I opted for the more expensive S540.All right, enough chit chatting. Now couple of pointers, you all are already bored with specs sheet, so I’m gonna spare you with that. Instead I’m gonna focus on the core user experience.Display: A display is the most important component of a laptop because you will be looking at it all the time. And it is expected to be at least good if not the best. Sadly, this is the least thought component in the segment.An FHD IPS Anti-glare display was best I was getting in this range and only Lenovo offered me from the top 3 brands. 250nits brightness is sufficient for day to day task and may feel short under direct sunlight although matte coating helps a lot in dispersing the indoor and outdoor light.I personally feel that color gamut should have been 72% NTSC or the 99%sRGB and not 45% NTSC which is the case here but then again, no other brand is offering the 72% in this price range. Not at all happy about this.Overall, if u don’t need an accurate color reproduction for professional photo editing, the display has best viewing angles, sufficient brightness and contrast for the binge watching or while working on that colorful assignment of yours.Keyboard and Touchpad: Lenovo is known for their keyboard and the one present on this device has good amount of travel, satisfying clickety clackety sound and enough spacing between the keys along with a premium glass frosted touchpad with windows precision gesture support. The inclusion of Numpad is the best decision which for some reason companies have started skimping on it and the two levels of brightness just for the backlight of the keyboard is icing on the cake.Battery Life: This model claims of up to 12 hours battery life which is a very bold claim for the given specs. I am happy to report that Lenovo lives up to their marketing term because I managed to squeeze out around 10+ hrs of battery from 100% to 35% on moderate use and I believe that it would have gone beyond 11+ hrs till it dropped dead to zero. I have also seen newer ultrabooks in the market barely touching a 5hr mark, so all in all this device has a terrific battery life without any doubts.Design: That exquisite full metal thin and angular body with diamond cut edges along with professional looking choice of color is a premium to look at and hold. The plastic body found in other brands is just no match in terms of looks and feels. Easy win for Lenovo.Processor, RAM, Graphic Card and Storage: Comet Lake Core i5 processor along with a 2gb Nvidia MX250 graphic card and 8gb of ram expandable up to 12gb with 256gb of SSD (best in this segment) and 1 TB HDD (a high quality). A good balance of storage and speed.Gamers stay away as this is meant for professionals and students and in no way can do serious gaming. This laptop tends to stay cool but running a GTA V with normal graphics and 1366 X 768p resolution heated the CPU to 65-70-degree Celsius range. And that amount of heat can affect the battery health and the laptop components with regular use.Nifty Features: Fast and Accurate Fingerprint sensor, the manual camera shutter for the privacy, the included MS Office 2019 home version along with 1 year of Lenovo Premium Warranty and Accidental Damage Protection, the Always On USB port for charging your other devices without waking up the laptop and inclusion of proper led indicators and ports (ultrabooks usually skimp out on HDMI and USB A port) overall makes this laptop the ‘Perfect’ ultrabook.But wait, there is nothing as Perfect in this world. And so far, it has been a love fest. So, bear with me for few more minutes while I cover the cons of this device.Fan Placement: I don’t like the fact that the placement of fan is at the bottom of the device. Because of its thin angular body, there was no space for a side vent thus pushing it to the bottom. At high loads, it might cause distress while using on a lap and may add to more thermal gains. Sadly, it is the case with every ultrabook out there so nothing much can be done.Speakers: Claiming to be Dolby Audio and placed at bottom of the device, these are just barely loud to cover your needs. In a quiet room they’re adequate for binge watching although it lacks the bass. I would suggest investing in good headphones or external speakers if you consume media a lot.Processor: This comes with Intel’s Comet Lake 10th Gen processor but it should have been an Ice Lake variant since it is fabricated on 10nm as opposed to 14nm and it is 2020. I guess that better display than other brands, Lenovo included was a trade-off keep the price lower and, in my opinion, a smart move. Those who are not aware, there is not much difference in terms of speed and processing it is just that Ice Lake is couple of months newer than Comet Lake.Camera: It's 2020 and Lenovo is still using a 720p HD 1MP webcam which is honestly way too bad. It's even bad for video calls. Luckily for me, I am not much into that. But if you are one of those rare breeds who rely on their laptop webcam, you have been warned.You made it to this far in the review, then I can be assured of that I started making sense all along which kept you such long and I personally thank you for sticking until now.My final thoughts to conclude the review. After a long detailed study on displays, processors and other components I came to a conclusion that Lenovo Ideapad S540 (Model: 81NG002BIN) with the thin full metal body having good display and sensible specifications along with Lenovo’s premium support for 1 year is the best bang for the buck you can get in the sub 65K market. Sure, it has some quirks but those can be simply ignored considering the overall package it fits into. I am confident that this device would be an ideal companion for College Students and Professionals likewise.

I was looking for a laptop with the following features:1) Thin & Light Design2) 15.6 inch screen with very thin bezel3) FHD display of 1920x10804) Expandable RAM with minimum of 8GB memory5) Hybrid Storage [SSD (For fast booting)+HDD (For critical data storage)]6) Dedicated Nvidia Graphics with atleast 2GB Memory7) Core i5 10th Gen processorTo my surprise this was the only laptop on Amazon to fulfill all my requirements.I was a bit skeptical to buy this looking at the mixed reactions from people. However, I will say this is a must buy product for people having requirements inline with mine.Thermal performance was initially an issue as the laptop was heating up in a short duration but with a quick update of Lenovo Vantage app which helped in enabling the "Intelligent Cooling" mode from the app which fixed the issue.Battery backup is amazing as well with a wonderful display quality. I received close to 10 hours of battery backup which was mind blowing.Looks is also stunning with metallic housing and sleek design.

Review_title: Hate you Amazon but love you Lenovo
Review_body: After a lots of study I found that this laptop is one of the best looking and featured laptop present in market in the price range between 60 to 70 K. Lenovo is a pure Chinese brand and I had bad experience in past. But the new Lenovo changed a lot. Coming back to some customers review, they reported of having received defective product and less days warrenty. Ok let me clear you all, this laptop costs arround 63 K and due to covid amazon increased the price and also I got this laptop after 15 days due to random unavailability. My 1st order got cancelled after 15 days cause they told me the order was archived (my guess due to out of stock, and for the same reason some of you got defective product) and in case of warrenty, you can update the purchase date from Lenovo's site by providing amazon's bill.Talking about laptop:Pros: Superior build quality and the unibody aluminium chessy give the laptop a premium looks, I guess this is one of the best looking laptop in the market right now. Students to business professionals, developer to casual use suits for every person. Latest Intel 10th Gen processor and Nvidia MX250 good for photo and video editing, light gaming and codding. SSD is superb, as per technical specification this is the fastest SSD installed in any device in this price range. Its a 2280 4 channel Hynix SSD and capable of 32 GBPS where rest are 2280 2 channels 16 GBPS. 2x2 intel non vpro wifi is great. Display coud be 300 nits and 72% color gamut, but its not, still manageable, though a different model of S540 have this feature but didn't find the model in amazon or local market. Extra 1 tb ssd, free windows, office 2019 and McAfee 1 year total security are extra bonus. Finger print works perfectly, keyboard backlit is ok, privacy webcam sutter is a very good features, speaker downfiring but still good. Glass touchpad just awesome. Some easter eggs like always on usb port, Charging level indicator during laptop off, lenovo vantage driver update, fast charging on-off, on laptop in ac mode without using battery, os backup and reset dedicated key and offline backup, different charging light blinking indicator, performance mode selector, different usefull function keys just extra add onsCons: RAM could be 2666Mhz, but its 2400. Bluetooth 4.2, not 5. Weight is 1.8 kg but still felt heavy. Battery very poor, max backup 4-5 hours in medium usage. Overhitting during gaming. 1 usb type c which doesn't support power delivery. Those who have screen flickering issue, please dont panic. Update bios and nvidia driver in safe mode or contact your local expart or lenovo techincl expart face to face. And yes keyboard, if you are not a lenovo user it will take time to habituate, keyboard could be better. And please provide one bag or sleeve in online purchase.Those who are interested to increase the warranty, please perches 1699 rs tps tech warrenty along with this, cause its not a cheap laptop at all.
Bad Speaker and online streaming issue (Video and voice mismatch), otherwise good laptop
Defective laptop. Amazon must ensure avoid this type if inconvenience to its die hard customer.

Guys if you are looking for a gaming laptop this is not the one! So please don't expect this laptop to not heat up while gaming! Please search gaming laptop in amazon and buy one!  Also, this is for professional Coding use! And this laptop does that work fine.

Review_title: My Worst Nightmare. Terrible Support from Lenovo.
Review_body: Note: I did not buy this on Amazon. I bought this frome the Lenovo website.Right when the lockdown struck us in early 2020, I decided to buy this laptop to prepare for my career progress plan.On paper this was the best config I could get under 70K (it was being sold at around 67K on Amazon then)The laptop arrived and within a couple of weeks I found out the audio was abysmal. I tried atleast 3 different earphones/headphones to make sure the problem was not with my earphones. After that contacting Lenovo was almost impossible as their lines would always be busy (limited staff the message said)And when I finally made contact, after making me update the drivers, reinstalling my OS, they shoved a 7 day (DOA - dead on arrival) policy in my face saying that since I had not reported it within 7 days I would not be offered a replacement. The best they said was they could get someone to repair/replace the motherboard.I put my foot down and so did they. The consumer forum was no big help either. So now I am stuck with a 60K+ laptop with a crackling audio which means my learning plans get crippled and I am left with a glorified browser.btw the laptop speakers are useless. At full volume you will get some decent sound.Moral: In the first seven days, test out all you can, and if you find one thing out of line, do not hang up till they connect (This comes with a one year support warranty)The next machine I buy will definitely not be a Lenovo.

But if you want to game, create content, and for any general entertainment purposes, I don't recommend it.

13/11/2020:The screen flickering issue is still an issue when the laptop is not placed on a stable ground, like if you hold the laptop in your hand in air the screen tends to flicker, I guess its some kind of loose connection or something. But nothing is wrong when it is placed on a laptop and screen is at any angle.This issue was solved when I updated windows but I guess it was a mere coincidence that it got solved right at that time.One thing I didn't like is that the USB and power port at both really tight, maybe due to the slim design. It's hard to plug in and plug out through the ports. You feel like it's gonna break.9/11/2020:There was a screen flickering issue, which was solved when the nvidia and bios was updated. Warrenty issue was fixed by mailing the amazon invoice to pop@lenovo.comSo you don't have to worry about these two issues.I saw a few reviews where the hinge was broken, luckily I didn't have this problem until now and don't know if it will fall apart after daily usage. For the camera part some reviews have shown it is the wost camera in a laptop. I feel these people haven't used a webcam before and was expecting high selfie qualities in a laptop. The camera is pretty decent, I must say. I thought it will be really bad after reading reviews, but I'm really happy about it. The bootup speed is 7-8 seconds and finger print unlock works in just a second. And for the weight, its pretty heavy and not a lightweight laptop. It weights around 1.8kg to 1.9kg but the build quality except the hinge is really good. The product arrived in good condition. As the warranty is from manufacturing date, I have 11 month warranty remaining. Not a big deal for me, as I fix my own laptop.With a weeks testing, the laptop is good for decent workloads. People who face issue (crashes etc.) watching YouTube videos, make sure to make nvidia your default graphics card for your browsers and other applications. The default is intel’s integrated graphics card. Sadly you have to set this for each program individually. This also frees up CPU resources. 8gb ram is okay (no lag found yet) for normal workloads. Will upgrade the ram to 12/16gb as need arise. Battery life is okayish with battery lasting for 5-6 hrs with moderate use. This could have been better.

Review_title: A very good configuration at a reasonable price
Review_body: I spend almost 8hrs a day on my Laptop. This laptop seems to be a little pricy, but at this price, the configuration is a good combination. The laptop looks sleek and compact. The screen resolution is high and the text is pretty crisp.After almost 7 days, the laptop doesn't heat up, the performance seems to be on the peak with the 10th generation processor. Corei5 has many plus points than the corei3, however, the difference is not that much noticeable between i5 and i7.Overall this laptop is faster, lightweight and doesn't heat up on your lap.The downside is that the ethernet port is missing.The USB 3.2 is a plus point, but I really can't use USB 3.2 for my old storage disks.Overall the laptop is great for all-day work with loads of graphics processing.

But your Government ID should have the same delivery address in Permanent Address Field. I cleared in call & they asked to send alternative documents; But Lenovo support team has the habit to move to On-Hold. SO its waste of time to clear your side words.Rule No2:They need the Dealer Seal Attestation in Bill. But you wont get Seal Attestation in online order Bill. So they moved my ticket to On-Hold to upload bill with Dealer seal. So you cant avail this offer if you purchase the laptop online.In their mail, you can see customer care number and email; but you ll get respond with automated mail and voices  only.  So please avoid Lenovo if you want to purchase with their 'Back2School' offerSo pl

Review_title: This laptop will put a smile on ur face (if you are not expecting a good camera). Go for it "Laptop"
Review_body: Got this product delivered in a day. The packing is not that great, as they wrapped a carton box which is about slightly bigger than the actual laptop box. But that's okay, as it is Amazon delivered.While checking the laptop found that the camera is not working (i.e. it was showing an orange circle even with the manual shutter open). I was about to raise a return request. But on having a closer look, I realized that there was a sticker over the camera lens mentioning about the camera manual shutter position. Once I pealed it off, I was happy to see camera is working... Oh thank God..!!!!First look review:* Laptop looks sleek but feel bit heavy while lifting. That heaviness will make you understand the build quality.* Full metal finish body.* Nice IPS display.* With Cortana enabled, Windows setup was very easy.* Excel can be seamlessly activated following the steps mentioned in YouTube video.* Wow.. It has caps lock and Num lock "ON" indicator light over the keys. Also a watermark displayed on screen while toggling them. (not some thing new, but feeling good as my earlier laptop didn't have this).* Nice back-lit keyboard. Initially I felt there is no much difference between two brightness levels in normal light. But on low light I could see significant difference in brightness levels.* The keyboard tray is sturdy.* Eye catching chrome boarders for Power button, Track pad and Finger Print scanner.* While registering finger print, it seems slow. So I doubted will it be the same while logging in. But it is not. Finger print login works nice and fast.* Boots up and Shut down in 3-5 sec max.* You will get 1 year free subscription for McAfee LiveSafe. Good...!!* Nice quality speakers with sharp sound and pleasing chillness.* Track pad has integrated button for right and left mouse keys, which was new to me. And I was struggling to find the location of the keys. After using it for some time, I felt some what comfortable. But still being conscious while using right mouse click.* Media keys (Play, Pause, Stop, Prev and Next) placements over Num-pad is a very comfortable position to use them.* While typing this review I could feel the advantage of having "U" shape in key bottoms. It really makes you to enjoy typing. And the key travel is very less.* Not sure why, I was hitting Num-Lock key instead of back-space when I started typing. I have to check the usual full sized keyboard layout. After using for some time, I could able to hit backspace properly.* Till now I felt laptop runs very silent. But could hear a fan spinning more for some 15-20 sec while updates was going on.* I could not see a 3D hologram sticker for Intel processor. The sticker for 10th generation processor looks very simple reflective sticker.* Finally there is a web camera just to show it is there. Because the resolution is very low.That's it.. Will update review after using it for a month.
The product is good but I am upset as the costly laptop doesn't come with a carry case.
if you purchase from Lenevo official website, get a more discount compare to Amazon with cash back offer. Over all good product but not so light. Battery backup not satisfactory.

Review_title: Great Product at this price range!!!!!!!
Review_body: I purchased this laptop on 25/06/2020 and the delivery was made the next day itself !!!! Hats of to Amazon for delivering it in a short span during this period. I will not be talking about the general features which have been mentioned everywhere, i ll mention what stood out and what did not.1) The battery life is around 6hour mark for normal use and if used in battery saver and other battery saving modes than it can cross the 8 hour mark.2)  I AM DISAPPOINTED WITH AMAZON FOR THIS ONE REASON : THE WARRANTY WAS ONLY FOR 8 MONTHS THOUGH THEY PROVIDE 12MONTHS WARRANTY. This is something i would want Amazon to clarify why it is so.3) The Keyboard is of the chiclet form and honestly if you are a person who is using the laptop for a lot of typing work then i would recommend that you would reconsider. The keyboard is not bad but its definitely not good for its price.4) It comes with FREE OFFICE HOME AND STUDENT 2019 for the full time and not just a trial. It also comes with a 1 year MCAFEE anti virus protection plan for free.5) I was little skeptical after reading all the screen flickering issues faced by some of the people who bought the laptop, i also faced screen flickering issue but if u update your BIOS and other things, it ceases to flicker.Overall I would say this is a must buy laptop, if your price range is between 50k-75k. No other product has both the features of an Ultrabook and the abilities of a medium gaming pc.

This laptop is packed with premium look, better performance, fast fingerprint scanner. SSD makes Windows 10 even better in quick and fast startup. Review_title: a great option if you are looking for a powerful and cute machine in a budget

Review_title: A Premium Ultrabook with not so Premium Price.
Review_body: I did quite an extensive study before purchasing this laptop. Why? Because I do not replace my laptop every year or so, I am not that Ritchie Rich type. My last laptop Lenovo Z50-70 was purchased 5 years ago, and it is still rocking as per current standards although I did swap out the HDD with an SSD for performance boost and battery backup is around 2.5 – 3 hrs which is surprisingly decent as per today’s standard.My point being I already  trust Lenovo brand with longevity and after sales support, but I wanted to try other brands just for a change. Apple was out of the scene since I wanted 15.6-inch screen and a Windows OS. So, I looked for other players like Dell, HP, Asus and Acer. Asus and Acer have quite an extensive line-up but from April – June 2020, most of them are on 8th gen processors. Plus, I have my doubts regarding its after sales support because they outsource it to private vendors instead of in-home service center.Coming to Dell, I am shocked to see that people end up paying the ‘Dell tax’. What does it mean? Well a 65K Dell Inspiron has a all plastic body, two decades old TN display, terrible battery life and users complaining about constant heating issues. HP has a similar story with partial plastic body and a TN display hiding under their marketing term as ‘SVA’ display.Leaving me no choice I looked at Lenovo and I immediately liked S340 and S540 (the model I am reviewing). S340 was 5-7k less expensive but lacked fingerprint sensor and has only partial metal body. I wanted full premium experience under 65K, so I opted for the more expensive S540.All right, enough chit chatting. Now couple of pointers, you all are already bored with specs sheet, so I’m gonna spare you with that. Instead I’m gonna focus on the core user experience.Display: A display is the most important component of a laptop because you will be looking at it all the time. And it is expected to be at least good if not the best. Sadly, this is the least thought component in the segment.An FHD IPS Anti-glare display was best I was getting in this range and only Lenovo offered me from the top 3 brands. 250nits brightness is sufficient for day to day task and may feel short under direct sunlight although matte coating helps a lot in dispersing the indoor and outdoor light.I personally feel that color gamut should have been 72% NTSC or the 99%sRGB and not 45% NTSC which is the case here but then again, no other brand is offering the 72% in this price range. Not at all happy about this.Overall, if u don’t need an accurate color reproduction for professional photo editing, the display has best viewing angles, sufficient brightness and contrast for the binge watching or while working on that colorful assignment of yours.Keyboard and Touchpad: Lenovo is known for their keyboard and the one present on this device has good amount of travel, satisfying clickety clackety sound and enough spacing between the keys along with a premium glass frosted touchpad with windows precision gesture support. The inclusion of Numpad is the best decision which for some reason companies have started skimping on it and the two levels of brightness just for the backlight of the keyboard is icing on the cake.Battery Life: This model claims of up to 12 hours battery life which is a very bold claim for the given specs. I am happy to report that Lenovo lives up to their marketing term because I managed to squeeze out around 10+ hrs of battery from 100% to 35% on moderate use and I believe that it would have gone beyond 11+ hrs till it dropped dead to zero. I have also seen newer ultrabooks in the market barely touching a 5hr mark, so all in all this device has a terrific battery life without any doubts.Design: That exquisite full metal thin and angular body with diamond cut edges along with professional looking choice of color is a premium to look at and hold. The plastic body found in other brands is just no match in terms of looks and feels. Easy win for Lenovo.Processor, RAM, Graphic Card and Storage: Comet Lake Core i5 processor along with a 2gb Nvidia MX250 graphic card and 8gb of ram expandable up to 12gb with 256gb of SSD (best in this segment) and 1 TB HDD (a high quality). A good balance of storage and speed.Gamers stay away as this is meant for professionals and students and in no way can do serious gaming. This laptop tends to stay cool but running a GTA V with normal graphics and 1366 X 768p resolution heated the CPU to 65-70-degree Celsius range. And that amount of heat can affect the battery health and the laptop components with regular use.Nifty Features: Fast and Accurate Fingerprint sensor, the manual camera shutter for the privacy, the included MS Office 2019 home version along with 1 year of Lenovo Premium Warranty and Accidental Damage Protection, the Always On USB port for charging your other devices without waking up the laptop and inclusion of proper led indicators and ports (ultrabooks usually skimp out on HDMI and USB A port) overall makes this laptop the ‘Perfect’ ultrabook.But wait, there is nothing as Perfect in this world. And so far, it has been a love fest. So, bear with me for few more minutes while I cover the cons of this device.Fan Placement: I don’t like the fact that the placement of fan is at the bottom of the device. Because of its thin angular body, there was no space for a side vent thus pushing it to the bottom. At high loads, it might cause distress while using on a lap and may add to more thermal gains. Sadly, it is the case with every ultrabook out there so nothing much can be done.Speakers: Claiming to be Dolby Audio and placed at bottom of the device, these are just barely loud to cover your needs. In a quiet room they’re adequate for binge watching although it lacks the bass. I would suggest investing in good headphones or external speakers if you consume media a lot.Processor: This comes with Intel’s Comet Lake 10th Gen processor but it should have been an Ice Lake variant since it is fabricated on 10nm as opposed to 14nm and it is 2020. I guess that better display than other brands, Lenovo included was a trade-off keep the price lower and, in my opinion, a smart move. Those who are not aware, there is not much difference in terms of speed and processing it is just that Ice Lake is couple of months newer than Comet Lake.Camera: It's 2020 and Lenovo is still using a 720p HD 1MP webcam which is honestly way too bad. It's even bad for video calls. Luckily for me, I am not much into that. But if you are one of those rare breeds who rely on their laptop webcam, you have been warned.You made it to this far in the review, then I can be assured of that I started making sense all along which kept you such long and I personally thank you for sticking until now.My final thoughts to conclude the review. After a long detailed study on displays, processors and other components I came to a conclusion that Lenovo Ideapad S540 (Model: 81NG002BIN) with the thin full metal body having good display and sensible specifications along with Lenovo’s premium support for 1 year is the best bang for the buck you can get in the sub 65K market. Sure, it has some quirks but those can be simply ignored considering the overall package it fits into. I am confident that this device would be an ideal companion for College Students and Professionals likewise.

I was looking for a laptop with the following features:1) Thin & Light Design2) 15.6 inch screen with very thin bezel3) FHD display of 1920x10804) Expandable RAM with minimum of 8GB memory5) Hybrid Storage [SSD (For fast booting)+HDD (For critical data storage)]6) Dedicated Nvidia Graphics with atleast 2GB Memory7) Core i5 10th Gen processorTo my surprise this was the only laptop on Amazon to fulfill all my requirements.I was a bit skeptical to buy this looking at the mixed reactions from people. However, I will say this is a must buy product for people having requirements inline with mine.Thermal performance was initially an issue as the laptop was heating up in a short duration but with a quick update of Lenovo Vantage app which helped in enabling the "Intelligent Cooling" mode from the app which fixed the issue.Battery backup is amazing as well with a wonderful display quality. I received close to 10 hours of battery backup which was mind blowing.Looks is also stunning with metallic housing and sleek design.

Review_title: Hate you Amazon but love you Lenovo
Review_body: After a lots of study I found that this laptop is one of the best looking and featured laptop present in market in the price range between 60 to 70 K. Lenovo is a pure Chinese brand and I had bad experience in past. But the new Lenovo changed a lot. Coming back to some customers review, they reported of having received defective product and less days warrenty. Ok let me clear you all, this laptop costs arround 63 K and due to covid amazon increased the price and also I got this laptop after 15 days due to random unavailability. My 1st order got cancelled after 15 days cause they told me the order was archived (my guess due to out of stock, and for the same reason some of you got defective product) and in case of warrenty, you can update the purchase date from Lenovo's site by providing amazon's bill.Talking about laptop:Pros: Superior build quality and the unibody aluminium chessy give the laptop a premium looks, I guess this is one of the best looking laptop in the market right now. Students to business professionals, developer to casual use suits for every person. Latest Intel 10th Gen processor and Nvidia MX250 good for photo and video editing, light gaming and codding. SSD is superb, as per technical specification this is the fastest SSD installed in any device in this price range. Its a 2280 4 channel Hynix SSD and capable of 32 GBPS where rest are 2280 2 channels 16 GBPS. 2x2 intel non vpro wifi is great. Display coud be 300 nits and 72% color gamut, but its not, still manageable, though a different model of S540 have this feature but didn't find the model in amazon or local market. Extra 1 tb ssd, free windows, office 2019 and McAfee 1 year total security are extra bonus. Finger print works perfectly, keyboard backlit is ok, privacy webcam sutter is a very good features, speaker downfiring but still good. Glass touchpad just awesome. Some easter eggs like always on usb port, Charging level indicator during laptop off, lenovo vantage driver update, fast charging on-off, on laptop in ac mode without using battery, os backup and reset dedicated key and offline backup, different charging light blinking indicator, performance mode selector, different usefull function keys just extra add onsCons: RAM could be 2666Mhz, but its 2400. Bluetooth 4.2, not 5. Weight is 1.8 kg but still felt heavy. Battery very poor, max backup 4-5 hours in medium usage. Overhitting during gaming. 1 usb type c which doesn't support power delivery. Those who have screen flickering issue, please dont panic. Update bios and nvidia driver in safe mode or contact your local expart or lenovo techincl expart face to face. And yes keyboard, if you are not a lenovo user it will take time to habituate, keyboard could be better. And please provide one bag or sleeve in online purchase.Those who are interested to increase the warranty, please perches 1699 rs tps tech warrenty along with this, cause its not a cheap laptop at all.
Bad Speaker and online streaming issue (Video and voice mismatch), otherwise good laptop
Defective laptop. Amazon must ensure avoid this type if inconvenience to its die hard customer.

Guys if you are looking for a gaming laptop this is not the one! So please don't expect this laptop to not heat up while gaming! Please search gaming laptop in amazon and buy one!  Also, this is for professional Coding use! And this laptop does that work fine.

This laptop is definitely worth the money.

Review_title: Not bad for under 5K, Amazing battery life.
Review_body: Writing this review after 5 days of usage. Will get straight to the good and bad.Pros:- The best part is is the battery life, when the watch came it had 90% battery, after 5 days of constant 24x7 Bluetooth connectivity, the battery is still showing 70%, I am fairly confident this will easily last 2 weeks for my usage pattern.- Great watch for under 5k- Screen display quality is good, it does not have a complete edge to edge display, but good enough that you dont notice the bezels.- The look & build quality is very premium.- The carbon fibre finish for the base looks very nice.- The watch is very lightweight, I was pleasantly surprised by this. You can wear it and forget it.- The watch has Blood pressure, SPO2, steps, heart rate monitoring along with usual fitness tracking and training modes.- The companion app is also fine, it syncs very quickly. Multiple watch faces to choose from, they keep changing every day.Cons:- I wish the watch dial had colour options, there is only one dial.- Also some other strap options to choose from. Amazon doesn't have any option, their site shows two options, but both are not great.- The gestures dont always work, in fact, I am not sure if there is gesture support and how it works? I often lift my wrist to view time but nothing happens, 90% of the time I end up pressing the button to view time.- The App has many watch faces to choose from, but at a time only can be uploaded to the watch. I wish this was more than 1 so we dont have to open app always.- The App should have some sort of like, wishlist mechanism so I can shortlist watch faces I like, I end up going through the entire list to find what I like, and as there is no way to save it. I end up doing this process every time.- The strap quality could have been better, but not a big deal as we can easily replace straps.

Received damaged/ used watch .. it has a scratch at sensors. To track any activity we to select manually .. For most of the activity, it tracks only BPM and time. Which is not meaning full i.e for cycling if we don't get kilometres or miles .. then what is it tracking.

Automatically switching off ,even after fully charged...seller refused when retured,amazon took no response from this issue, totally we got lose on purchasing this watch through amazon.damaged or worthless product from the seller..seller simply refused the returned watch without any reason and when I called amazon assistance they simply saying to go for service centre,even having return policy in purchase

Review_title: Please go for branded products . No star
Review_body: Purchased last month end..worked only for 10  days..wasted 5000 on purchasing this watch..watch display totally dead..not able to contact seller..pressure monitor totally wrong systolic showing 50 mm/hg lower diastolic 30 lower.

Imagine you bought a vehicle with all the features and the vehicle performs great. So, till now you have a great product. Now, a few days later your vehicle breaks down and you come to know that your vehicle's fuel filter is not capable of doing what it is supposed to. So, regardless of how good our vehicle is with all the latest features, it is useless.Same is the case with Crossbeats Ace. You do not get a screen guard. The ones that are available and which are the closest match, does not fit. So, I hardly wear the watch fearing scratches. That's the reason for giving a single star. And believe me you will get the scratches irrespective of how careful you are. If Crossbeats provide the screen protector, I will update the ratings.Now, the features.1. Blood Pressure Monitoring is grossly inaccurate.2. Steps counting is ok to some extent. I was surprise to see that it counted 6000 steps when the initial reading was 350. The watch counted my steps even when I was driving.3. Oxymeter reading is fairly accurate.4. Activity reading with regards to Badminton is also ok. The rest I have not checked.5. Clock faces are useless. Except the default one, you cannot customize other downloaded faces.6. Notifications are fine but at times you won't get. Looks like the watch hangs.7. Water proofing is solid.8. Lookwise, it's really good.Increased the stars to 3 on Dec 8, 2020 due to followup from the seller.
Not bad

Review_title: A budget smart watch for beginners
Review_body: Rating after 1 month moderate use.It is a budget smart watch for beginners.Good to track activities, vital signs.Battery is awesome.Notifications are working well, please note you have to enable notifications in ur phone's settings.UI & App should improve.Expecting firmware updates.

Review_title: Functions well and measurements are fairly accurate. Wife loves it!
Review_body: All functions work well except real time heart rate monitoring. The heart rate monitor works fine in normal circumstances but real time heart rate monitoring is not accurate which can be tested after workouts or exercises. Blood Pressure and Blood Oxigen measurements are fairly accurate and we tested it with Oximeters and Blood Pressure monitors. Lack of an 'Always On' display is a bit of a trade off but not a deal breaker in my view as the main purpose of gifting this to my wife was to use it for health monitoring. But to some, lack of an always-on display can be a main criteria and in such a case I hope this review helps! Otherwise, at this price point this watch delivers much much more than the ones priced twice as high.
The BP measurements are quite different from what I check on my cuff monitor, so you can't be sure if other readings are accurate. Battery life is excellent.

Review_title: Good attempt for the first Fitness band from cross beats

It can be improved.Cons:- Heart rate won't work properly when we are doing any activity. It works until there is no sweat on wrist. This makes band of no use in counting calories.- Font style in the watch are pathetic.- DaFit app is just ok. It won't show hour wise foot steps.- Worst sleep tracking. Always shows above 90% sleep quality.- Battery comes for a week, not as claimed as 15days.- So called 3D hologram is not that great.

Review_title: Very good smart watch at a reasonable price
Review_body: Today is 10th day of using my Crossbeats ACE. I really like the product and here's my review to help others decide. My only activity is walking.- Price is very reasonable. Other companies' product with same features are priced at least double and upto quadruple.- Battery with normal usage lasted for 9 days. However, it was showing 53% remaining on 8th day and suddenly exhausted on 9th day.- Oxymeter and HR tracker seem quite accurate. Even BP meter was good enough for me (I have normal BP) but not sure how it would behave for people with abnormal BP.- Continuous HR tracking is done every 30 mins which should be enough for most cases.- Steps and sleep tracking are very accurate.- Android app is very good. Fluid UI, one shot connection with watch and no stability issues with app.- Magnetic charger is very good and you don't have to insert cable or struggle with straps. It takes ~2.5 hrs to fully charge.What it does not have:- Altimeter- GPS- Interoperability with Google Fit app- Constant HR tracking (it tracks every 30 mins only)- Automatic activity trackerI hope this helps you make right decision on your purchase.
Good battery life, and nice features for the price

Review_title: A watch perfect watch with few improvements needed !!
Review_body: This is a fitness watch which has most of the required functionality one might ask for like* Sp02* Heart rate* BP* Step count* sleep monitoretc etc...But only problem is I found the step, sleep and the Sp02 to be a bit inaccurate when compared with other smart watch.For the price which they have charged, I expected a better interface for the watch and as well as the mobile app.They have more than 200+ watchface available for this but you can add only 1 custom watch face at a time in watch, everytime you want to change the watch face you will need internet and download it via the da.Fit app, which is painful.The camera shutter works only in with the in built daFit app camera, you can't use it to click on any other application.Quality of the strap is really good and skin friendly too.So to summarise this watch gives you a lot of features and from a hardware perspective it sounds good, but they will have to work on the software side a lot in order to give customers a better experience.Hope fully they will give a OTA which addresses at least some of the issues.I found it to be a bit of overkill for the price they are selling this. I bought it for Rs.4999.May be 3-3.5K would have been a ideal price for the quality of the product they are giving.P.S: They don't see any additional straps as of now.

Immediately I sent mail to return desk no reply and sent mail to customer care and they told to do.some trouble shooting, did and nothing fixed so asked me to send the device to them and sent it and after a month they told issue has been solved and we will send the product to you, so after several follow ups , finally the repaired watch came to me on 24.10.2020 and I exited to it , but unfortunately the useless watch not powering on after Charging also it never powered on. Really I am pissed off on your product. I want full refund and have sent mail again to.the always busy customer service and waiting for their reply. I have been using it for 3 weeks now. I used to have a Fitbit charge 2 and my comparison is influenced by the Fitbit that I used for 3 years. I had to change as the battery of Fitbit was not even holding up for a day.The positives -Display is amazing and fancy. I like it.  It allows you to select from many clock faces which is nice.Battery is the best. I charged it to full before starting to use. In three weeks, I charged it additionally just once after the battery went below 50 percent after 20 days. So this battery is a beast.Functions - I like the BP, SpO2 functions although I am not sure about the accuracy. Will have to calibrate against a hospital device for confirmation.Swimproof is something great!What I lack -My fitbit used to automatically determine inclines. I do exercise by climbing stairs and this is not determined while my fitbit used to automatically do that.Exercises - Again fitbit used to automatically determine your exercise activity and monitor if you are running, walking , cycling or on an elliptical. This does not do any of that and we have to manually select it. Hope they can incorporate this into future firmware updates.Overall, it's a good watch for this price but not the best in term of functions especially if you have used something like a Fitbit earlier.

I bought the watch from the official cross beats website as it is out of stock on amazon currently.The packing was very good and contents of the package were neatly packed. Connecting with the mobile is quite simple and easy. Application is itself very easy to use.Display - Very good display for the price paid. For me the holographic display is not something astonishing but not bad either. It is fairly good. The colours are good. Display when off is completely black, though not like an amoled one, but much better then other normal displays.Build quality - The watch gives a premium feel,  The dial size is perfect for a medium wrist type. I was earlier planning to buy honor magic watch 2, but as i had seen somebody wearing it, i knew it would look big for a medium wrist like mine.Strap quality is amazing both in terms of look and comfort. Watch is very light to wear.Features - spo2, heart rate, step count and blood pressure are very good features to have and i am sure no other watch in this price range gives these features in one package. Breath training is bogus and not usefull at all. I mean i did not understand the benefit of it, you can easily find apps for it which have variations too.Accuracy -1. Step counts are fairly accurate.2. HR -I could see the HR increasing and decreasing as per the level of activity i was doing and seemed fairly accurate to me.3. BP - Cant comment on its accuracy, however the 2-3 times i checked at a few mins gap, it showed within normal range but slightly diff values.4. Spo2 saturation is useful and seemed accurate to me as when i checked multiple times it came out to be 97 or 98 which is a normal count for a healthy individual.5. Sleep analysis - yet to check.For me, features available in other watches like calling and listening to music are useless. My experience tells me that such features are used for a few days only, out of excitement about your new device and then that excitement goes. So, i was never looking for something with which i can receive calls or listen to music. Because, for that purpose, i do have truely wireless earphones/bluetooth speaker and most importantly i would never like anybody to over hear my conversation when i talk on the watch's speaker.Watch faces - Good number of watch faces including both digital and analog types to choose from.Battery backup - yet to check.Brightness - it is really good in indoors and outdoors too. It is manually adjustable.Cons -1. No always on display feature.2. No option to set the screen wake up/sleep time. Sometimes i feel that the display goes off too quickly, when there is no always on display, there has to be an option to adjust the screen time.3. Vibration strength is just okay. Though sufficient. I know i will get used to it.Overall -I had been looking for a balanced package from the available options. My budget was more, but i settled down on this one and do not regret my decision.It completely gives a much better value for money. However, its durability and water resistance, battery efficiency etc will be tested with time.You should definitely go for it without a doubt 👍

Nice products 👌👍. Need improvement like watch faces, while call coming the top of the glass we can feel the much vibration but not at the bottom. And from the main screen to right side slide  to see watch info is not necessary. What is the use you can move inside. Like need some more .

The look and feel is just premium. Touch sensor is good. I have tested oxygen meter with real device and it shows accurate... Steps count are also accurate with few steps different but it doesn't matter. Batter life is good I used for a week and still. Left. With 60 percent... Continues hear rate monitor is helpful. Overall a satisfying buy... But still there is a room of improvement to add more features like answering calls and sending sort msgs and also add more trainings....

One thing I have enjoyed about Crossbeats products is it's more than adequate market research that lets them offer a pretty good deal.The watch looks more premium than a smart watch in the 5k segment.The display works well even on a bright sunny day. There's a fair share of faces to choose from.. and though not all of them are that great, I did end up finding one that suited my tastes.I am yet to verify the blood pressure and SPO 2 readings with a medical device but seems pretty legit. It measured identical heart rates when I wore both, this watch as well as Honor band 4.The battery optimization in this watch is unheard of with a steady 12 days despite heavy usage.It has surpassed my expectations in many waysThere are certain areas with a scope for improvement-1. App optimization could be better : when compared with interfaces of Huawei Health or MI, the Dafit user experience still has a lot of scope for improvement. For eg.. for the data analytics of steps, it doesn't show the hourly representation of steps on a chart. It only shows the total no of steps in a day.2. There should be a firmware upgrade that lets the user change the order in which the screens appear in the watch. For eg.. I'd prefer customising the screen order such that the music control screen comes up in the beginning3. As the straps are replaceable, there should be an option to purchase additional straps.4. The camera feature that lets us click pics should be more discreet nd not require us to have the camera app physically open at all times.5. Further upgrades should include some means to control the vibration on the watch6. There should be volume controls in the music control screen
